summary: Valencia is a major city in Spain, located on the Mediterranean Sea. It was founded by the Romans and has a rich history, including periods under Visigothic, Islamic, and Christian rule. Today, it's Spain's third-largest city with over 800,000 inhabitants. It's known for its historic center, the Port of Valencia (one of Europe's busiest), and festivals like Falles. The city has been recognized for its quality of life and has won titles like European Capital of Sport and World Design Capital.
title: Valencia
